antiPatterns.name: Ambiguous Interface
antiPatterns.description: Is an antipattern where the interfaces of a component offer a single and very general entry-point.
antiPatterns.detection: Interface offers and processes multiple services, but offers only one public service. Usually all requests are accepted and internally other services are invoked.
antiPatterns.consequences: Reduce analyzability and understandability, because the component does not show the services that are accepted. Therefore a user has to analyze the implementation of the component before using it.
antiPatterns.cause: Especially appears in pub-sub systems, where the interactions are not explicitly modeled and multiple components exchange event messages via a shared event bus.
antiPatterns.solution: Split single-entry point up into multiple more specialized entry-points.
antiPatterns.example: Interface with a single public method that takes a generic type as parameter.
